HELP_CALCULATING_INTEREST.CALCULATE_THIS: To calculate this, use the steps below.

EXAMPLE.ANNUAL_INTEREST: the annual interest would be £80 (1000 x 0.08 = 80) you’d divide £80 by 365 to get the daily interest: about 22p a day (80 / 365 = 0.22) after 50 days this would be £11 (50 x 0.22 = 11)

STEPS.DAILY_INTEREST: Work out the daily interest: divide your yearly interest from step 1 by 365 (the number of days in a year).
STEPS.TOTAL_INTEREST: Work out the total amount of interest: multiply the daily interest from step 2 by the number of days the debt has been overdue.
STEPS.YEARLY_INTEREST: Work out the yearly interest: take the amount you’re claiming and multiply it by 0.08 (which is 8%).

HELP_CALCULATING_INTEREST.TITLE: Help calculating interest
HELP_CALCULATING_INTEREST.USUAL_RATE: For most types of debt the rate is usually 8%.

HELP_WITH_INTEREST_RATES.THE_COURT_WILL_DECIDE: The court will decide if you're entitled to some or all of the interest claimed.
HELP_WITH_INTEREST_RATES.TITLE: Help with interest rates
HELP_WITH_INTEREST_RATES.YOU_CAN_CLAIM: You can claim 8% interest on money owed to you. This is the statutory rate. If you know that a different rate applies you can use that. For example if you have a contract with a specific rate

START_PAGE.CHECK_THE_ORDER_P1: Check the order the court sent you for what documents you need to upload for your case.
START_PAGE.YOU_CANNOT_WITHDRAW: You cannot withdraw a document once you have submitted it. If you want to add more information to something you have already submitted, you can upload the document again. you should add a version number to the name, for example 'version 2.'
START_PAGE.THE_OTHER_PARTIES: The other parties will be able to see the documents you have uploaded and you will be able to see their documents.
START_PAGE.CHECK_THE_ORDER_P2: Check the order the court sent you for the deadlines for uploading your documents.
START_PAGE.AFTER_THE_DEADLINE: After the deadline, you will have to apply to the court if you want any new document to be used at the trial or hearing.
START_PAGE.YOU_DO_NOT_HAVE: You do not have to upload all your documents at once. You can return to upload them later.
START_PAGE.BEFORE_YOU_UPLOAD: Before you upload the document, give it a name that tells the court what it is, for example 'Witness statement by Jane Smith.'
START_PAGE.EACH_DOCUMENT_MUST: Each document must be less than 100mb. You can upload the following file types: DOC/DOCX (Word), XLS/XLSM (Excel), PPT/PPTX (PowerPoint), PDF, RTF, TXT, CSV, JPG/JPEG, PNG, BMP, TIF/TIFF.

TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.IF_THE_CLAIMANT_DISAGREES: If the claimant disagrees with your response, you must take part in mediation.
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.A_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION_APPOINTMENT: A telephone mediation appointment will be scheduled at no additional cost.
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.AN_IMPARTIAL_MEDIATOR: An impartial mediator will speak with both parties to see if an agreement can be reached before the case goes to court. You will be able to explain your reasons for rejecting the claim in more detail.
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.MEDIATION_WILL_LAST: Mediation will last no longer than one hour and will take place by telephone.
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.WE_WILL_ARRANGE: We will arrange a phone call with a mediator from the Small Claims Mediation Service. The mediator will:
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.BULLET_LIST_ITEM1: listen to each side separately – you will not talk directly to the other side
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.BULLET_LIST_ITEM2: ask you to consider what the other side says
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.BULLET_LIST_ITEM3: help you reach an agreement, if possible
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.WHAT_HAPPENS_IF: What happens if you do not attend your mediation appointment?
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.IF_YOU_DO_NOT_ATTEND: If you do not attend your mediation appointment, the judge may apply a penalty. This could include the judge automatically ruling in the other party’s favour, or paying for some or all of the other party’s costs.
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.IF_MEDIATION_IS_SUCCESSFUL: If mediation is successful, you will not have to go to court. You will make a agreement over the phone, which we will email to you. You will not have to sign anything, but the agreement is binding.
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.IF_EITHER_PARTY: If either party breaks the terms of the agreement, the other party can go back to the court to ask for a judgment or hearing.
TELEPHONE_FOR_MEDIATION.IF_YOU_DO_NOT_REACH: If you do not reach an agreement at mediation, you may need to attend a court hearing. Any mediation discussions cannot be mentioned at the hearing.

CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.ACCEPT_OR_TRANSFER: They can accept the amount you've paid and settle the claim, or ask the court to transfer the claim to a County Court hearing centre.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.ADMIT_ALL_CANT_PAY: If you admit all of the claim but can't pay immediately, you can offer to pay the claimant in instalments.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.ADMIT_ALL_DEADLINE: You have until 4pm on {{ deadline }} to admit the claim.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.AGAINST_INDIVIDUAL: If the claim is against you as an individual, the hearing centre will be the nearest one to your home or business.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_ACCEPT_OFFER: If the claimant accepts your offer, they can ask the court to enter a CCJ against you and you'll be sent an order to pay.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_ACCEPT_PART_ADMISSION: If the claimant accepts your part-admission and you can't pay immediately, you can offer to pay in instalments.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_AGREES: If the claimant agrees, they can ask court to enter a CCJ against you and you'll be sent an order to pay.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_INDIVIDUAL: If the claimant is an individual and the claim is against you as an organisation, the hearing centre will be the nearest one to their home or business.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_RECEIPT: You should ask the claimant to give you a receipt.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_REJECT_OFFER: If the claimant rejects your offer, they can ask the court to enter a CCJ against you. The court will then decide the repayment plan.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.CLAIMANT_REJECT_PART_ADMISSION: If they reject your offer, the court will decide a repayment plan.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.FULL_ADMISSION: I admit all of the claim
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.FULL_ADMISSION_HINT: You agree you owe the full amount claimed.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.FULL_DEFENCE_HINT: You've either paid what you believe you owe or you reject the claim.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.HOW_DO_YOU_RESPOND: How do you respond to the claim?
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.IF_ADMIT_ALL: If you admit all of the claim and want to pay it in full, including interest and claim fee, contact the claimant to arrange payment.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.IF_ADMIT_ALL_AND_PAY: If you pay at the same time as admitting the claim, you won't get a County Court Judgment (CCJ).
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.IF_PROCEED: If they proceed, the claim may be transferred to a County Court hearing centre.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.PART_ADMIT: To admit part of the claim, contact the claimant and pay the amount you believe you owe then send the court your part admission.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.PART_ADMIT_DEADLINE: You have until 4pm on {{ deadline }} to admit part of the claim.
CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.PART_ADMISSION_HINT: You agree you owe some money but not the full amount claimed.

CITIZEN_RESPONSE_TYPE.REJECT_WHOLE_CLAIM: If you reject all of the claim, the claim may be transferred to a County Court hearing centre.

ELIGIBILITY_USEFUL_INFO_FEES.CONTINUE_HELP_WITH_FEES: Do you wish to continue to make a Help with Fees Application?
ELIGIBILITY_USEFUL_INFO_FEES.HELP_WITH_FEES: If you want to apply for Help with Fees, you will complete an online form in a new window. This will give you a reference number. Please note the number and keep it safe, as you will need it later in the claim process. (NB: if you have more than one claim going on, each claim must have a separate Help with Fees application and reference number). You can send in your claim as soon as you have the Help with Fees reference number, but the claim will not be issued until the Help with Fees application has been processed by the court. This is so that you will know what fees are covered and what you still have to pay. If you choose not to pay, the claim will not be issued. The claim will stop here unless you change your mind within 95 days.
ELIGIBILITY_USEFUL_INFO_FEES.HELP_WITH_FEES_ADVICE: You may be asked by the court to email evidence in support of your application before your claim is issued.
ELIGIBILITY_USEFUL_INFO_FEES.HELP_WITH_FEES_INTRO: Making an application for Help with Fees does not guarantee that you will get your fee covered. You may still have to pay some or all of your court fee to get the claim issued (for the court system to officially start the claim and send details to the other side). When you apply for Help with Fees, you should receive an update from us within 5 working days, giving you the result of your application.
ELIGIBILITY_USEFUL_INFO_FEES.TITLE: Some useful information about Help with Fees

EXPERT_DETAILS.TELL_US_WHY_NEED_EXPERT: Tell us why you need this expert

EXPERT_GUIDANCE.ASK_PERMISSION: You must ask for permission to use an expert - a judge will then decide whether the expert is necessary.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.COST_HIRING_EXPERT: The cost of hiring an expert depends on which expert you and the other party choose.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.EXPERT_REPORT: The expert will provide a written report - they won't usually come to court in person.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.FOR_EXAMPLE: For example, they might allow a structural engineer to be used in a claim about building works or a mechanic in a claim about car repairs.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.IF_JUDGE_ALLOWS: If a judge allows you to use an expert, you'll usually have to share one expert with the other party.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.IF_PERMISSION: If you get permission to use an expert
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.IF_YOU_WIN: If you win the case you may be able to recover a maximum of £750 of the cost you paid. A judge will rule on this at the end of the hearing.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGE_ALLOW_EXPERT: A judge will only allow you to use an expert if they believe they need the expert's specialist knowledge.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGE_DECIDE_COST: The judge will also decide whether the cost of the expert is reasonable compared to the value of the claim.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGE_MAY_ASK: The judge may ask one of you to make a list of 3 independent experts who can provide a written report in return for a fee.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.JUDGES_RESPONSIBLE_COST: Even though you and the other party share the cost of hiring the expert, judges are still responsible for keeping costs in proportion to value.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.MUST_AVOID_DISCUSSING: You must avoid discussing the case in detail with the 3 experts.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.OTHER_PARTY_CHOOSES: The other party then chooses one expert from the list. After that, you both need to follow these steps
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.PAY_EXPERT: Pay the expert - you usually both share this cost.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.PROVIDE_EXTRA: Provide any extra information the expert asks for.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.PROVIDE_QUESTIONS: Provide questions for the expert to answer in a report.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.RARE: It's rare for judges to allow you to use an expert in a small claim.
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.SEND_EXPERT_REPORT: Send the expert's report to the court (only one of you will have to do this).
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.TITLE: Using an expert in small claims
EXPERT_GUIDANCE.USUALLY_SHARE_COST: Usually you both share this cost.

FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.AUTOMATICALLY_REGISTERED: We have automatically registered you for free telephone mediation from HM Courts and Tribunals Service.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.CLAIMANT_MUST_AGREE: The claimant must agree to mediation. We'll contact you within 28 days after the claimant's confirmation, to arrange a free appointment.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.DO_NOT_AGREE_TO_FREE_MEDIATION: I do not agree to free mediation
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.EITHER_PARTY_BREAKS_TERMS: If either party breaks the terms the other party can go to court to ask for a judgment or hearing.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.LAST_LESS_AN_HOUR: Your mediation appointment will last for no more than an hour.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.MEDIATION_SUCCESSFUL: If mediation is successful, you'll make a verbal agreement over the phone. This is legally binding which means that you must comply with it. You will be given the terms of the agreement in a document – this is called a settlement agreement.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.MEDIATION_IS_CONFIDENTIAL: Mediation is confidential, and nothing said in the mediation can be used in court proceedings if the dispute cannot be settled. The mediator speaks to each party separately, this is not a conference call.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.MEDIATION_FAILS: If mediation fails and a court hearing is needed, what happened during the mediation appointment cannot be mentioned in court.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.MEDIATION_QUICKER: Mediation can be quicker, cheaper and less stressful than going to court.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.NO_AGREE: I do not agree to free mediation
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.NEUTRAL_MEDIATOR_LISTEN: A trained, neutral mediator from HM Courts and Tribunals Service will listen to your views and help you to negotiate a settlement of your dispute.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.NO_WAIT_COURT_HEARING: You will not have to wait longer for a court hearing if you choose mediation.
FREE_TELEPHONE_MEDIATION.OPENS_IN_NEW_TAB: free telephone mediation (opens in new tab).

UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.COSTS_HINT: A detailed list of the costs you have incurred in making or defending the claim, for example photocopying, getting copies of contracts, include receipts
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DISCLOSURE_LIST_HINT: A list of the documents that you must show the other parties
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENTARY_EVIDENCE_HEARING_HINT: Documents that you wish to rely on at the hearing, including emails, receipts, invoices, contracts and photos. You do not need to add documents that you have already added under witness evidence
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENTARY_EVIDENCE_TRIAL_HINT: Documents that you wish to rely on at the trial, including emails, receipts, invoices, contracts and photos. You do not need to add documents that you have already added under witness evidence
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENTS_FOR_DISCLOSURE_HINT: Recorded information that you must show the other parties - for example, contracts, invoices, receipts, emails, text messages, photos, social media messages
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENTS_REFERRED_TO_STATEMENT: Documents referred to in the statement
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.DOCUMENTS_REFERRED_TO_STATEMENT_HINT: Documents you or your witness refer to in the statement, including emails, receipts, invoices, contracts and photos
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.EXPERTS_REPORT_HINT: A written report by your expert. Expert evidence is an opinion based on the expertise of a specialist, for example - a building surveyor who can comment on the quality of building work. An expert is not a legal representative
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.JOINT_STATEMENT_OF_EXPERTS_HINT: A statement by the experts for both parties, setting out the facts in the case that they agree on or disagree on. This only applies if you and the other party set up a meeting for your experts. The experts write this statement after their discussion
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.LEGAL_AUTHORITIES_HINT: You can use legal authorities to support your case. These are Acts of Parliament, Rules - for example, the Civil Procedure Rules - or other court cases that have decided a point that is relevant to your case. Copy and paste the relevant extracts from Acts, Rules or cases into a document to upload
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.NOTICE_OF_INTENTION: Notice of intention to rely on hearsay evidence
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.NOTICE_OF_INTENTION_HINT: Notice to tell the other parties that you intend to rely on hearsay evidence at the trail. If the evidence is in a witness statement and the witness is not going to be in court, you must say why
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.QUESTIONS_FOR_OTHER_PARTY: Questions for other party's expert or joint expert
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.QUESTIONS_FOR_OTHER_PARTY_HINT: Written questions about an expert's report or a joint statement of experts
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.SELECT_THE_TYPE_OF_DOCUMENT: Select the types of documents that apply to your case. You may not need to upload documents for every category.
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.SKELETON_ARGUMENT_HINT: Summary of the case, the areas in dispute and the reasons why you think those disputes should be resolved in your favour
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.TITLE: What types of documents do you want to upload?
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.WITNESS_STATEMENT_HINT: A written statement of what your witness wants to tell the court
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.WITNESS_SUMMARY_HINT: If you cannot get a written statement from your witness, you can write a summary of the evidence you would want to include in the witness statement. You must apply to the court to use a witness summary at the hearing. You must do this before the deadline. Use
UPLOAD_EVIDENCE_DOCUMENTS.YOUR_STATEMENT_HINT: A written statement of what you want to tell the court

UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.TITLE: Upload your documents
UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.CHECK_THE_ORDER: Check the order the court sent you for what documents you need to upload for your case.
UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.YOU_CANNOT_WITHDRAW: You cannot withdraw a document once you have submitted it. If you want to add more information to something you have already submitted, you can upload the document again. You should add a version number to the name, for example 'version2'.

UPLOAD_YOUR_DOCUMENTS.YOU_DO_NOT_HAVE: You do not have to upload all your documents at once. You can return to upload them later.

FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.TITLE: Finalise your trial arrangements
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_HAVE_UNTIL_DATE: You have until {{ hearingDueDate }} to provide this information.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_SHOULD_FINALISE: You should finalise your trial arrangements to ensure the court has the necessary information for the trial to proceed in a suitable way.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IS_THE_CASE_READY_FOR_TRIAL: Is the case ready for trial?
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.WE_ARE_ASKING_YOU: We are asking you to confirm the case is ready for the trial. This means you have taken all the action required of you in the
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IF_YOUR_CASE_NOT_READY: If your case is not ready and you do not think it will be ready by the deadline for finalising your trial arrangements, you may wish to postpone or adjourn the trial. To do this, you will need to make an application to the court.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IF_YOU_NEED_TO_MAKE_APPLICATION: If you need to make an application, you must complete and submit your trial arrangements first.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_SHOULD_ONLY_MAKE_AN_APPLICATION: You should only make an application once this has been completed. There will be a link to make an application once you have finalised your trial arrangements.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IF_YOU_MAKE_APPLICATION: If you make an application, please note the trial will go ahead as planned until the application is reviewed by a judge and an order made changing the date of the trial.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_WILL_BE_ASKED: You will be asked to specify if there are any changes to the support or adjustments you previously specified in your
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_SHOULD_REVIEW: You should review this to identify if your circumstances have changed.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.WE_WILL_REMIND_YOU: We will remind you of the time allocated for the trial. If you feel less time is needed, you can specify why in the 'other information' box.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.IF_YOU_FEEL_THAT: If you feel that more time will be required, you will need to liaise with the other party and make an application to the court.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.YOU_SHOULD_ONLY_MAKE_APPLICATION: If you need to make an application, you must complete and submit your trial arrangements first. You should only make an application once this has been completed.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.OTHER_INFORMATION_TEXT: You will be given the opportunity to provide any other information relevant to the trial, for example if any party is only available at a specific time.
FINALISE_TRIAL_ARRANGEMENTS.ARE_THERE_ANY_CHANGES: Are there any changes to support with access needs or vulnerability for anyone attending a court hearing?
